page.title: 16BIBURY VILLAGE LIFE MAGAZINE
page.content: The first Village Life Magazine was published in October 1979 when a group of villagers thought it would be a good idea to have a magazine to help communication within the villages. it is an independent magazine, the cost being met by local businesses advertising in the Trade Directory, and by donations, and fund raising events. The magazine consists of dates for the diary, recipes, childrens corner, church services and notes of general interest. It comes out once a month except for August. A free copy is given to every house in Bibury, Ablington, Arlington and Winson. Eight people from the villages concerned run the magazine, including the editor and treasurer. Everything for the magazine is supplied from the village including the drawings on the covers, some of which come from holding competitions.
